intro: Galium asprellum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium asprellum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
